wikipedia_page.main: Sir Christopher Charles Gent HonFREng (born 10 May 1948) is a British businessman, He is the former chief executive officer of Vodafone, a British multinational mobile phone company. Until 2015, he served as the non-exec chairman of GlaxoSmithKline, the world's fourth largest pharmaceutical company.

response: Chris Gent, previously CEO of Vodafone, was appointed chairman of the board in 2005."Sir Christopher Gent to exit GlaxoSmithKline", The Daily Telegraph, 28 October 2012. GSK opened its first R&D centre in China in 2007, in Shanghai, initially focused on neurodegenerative diseases.

In January 1997, Whent retired and Chris Gent took over as CEO. In the same year, Vodafone introduced its Speechmark logo, composed of a quotation mark in a circle, with the Os in the Vodafone logotype representing opening and closing quotation marks and suggesting conversation.
Chris Gent was the Managing Director from 1979 to 1985, when he left to lead Vodafone. In 1985 most of BARIC's bureau business was acquired by CMG (Computer Management Group).
* Chris Gent, National Chairman 1977/79. Chairman of GlaxoSmithKline
* Chris Gent, former CEO and chairman of Vodafone

According to The Register of Members' Financial Interests, as at 21 January 2019, he was paid £15,000 per annum by the UK Water Partnership, a not-for-profit company set up to promote the interests of the UK water sector; and employs his sister, Catherine Haig, as a part-time researcher. He received donations amounting to £8,250 in 2018, from Philip Lavallin Wroughton (3 payments amounting to £7,000) and from Chris Gent (a single payment of £1,250).
